metadata.title: CVE-2019-9810 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Incorrect alias information in IonMonkey JIT compiler for Array.prototype.slice method may lead to missing bounds check and a buffer overflow. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 66.0.1, Firefox ESR < 60.6.1, and Thunderbird < 60.6.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-9810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
